comments.commentBody: You are in our hearts, Lindsey.  Give it everything you've got and let the chips fall where they they may!

They can't even prepare a reliable Zamboni?   These Olympics should have taken place in Pyeongchang, South Korea, which lost the 2010 bid to Vancouver by a few votes.  Pyeongchang has REAL cold weather and REAL snow and REAL mountains.  I hope they get the bid in 2018.  I just want to see these athletes get a chance to compete at their best!
I think you mean "Dutch oompah band"?

Seeing Alex win put me close to tears...it could not have happened to a better person.  And watching him get choked up about his brother was so touching to see.  He represents the best in Canadians.  And congrats to Bryon Wilson of the US on Bronze!

I'm excited about Donna Karan's collection. Her female is so striking; nothing overdone, nothing too sharp, not vampy, but clearly sexy. Her chenille wraps or coat sweaters are something I'd love to wrap myself in, sleep in if I could, and still wear out to dinner.

How is it that she just continues to get better after all these years?

I see the drama w/Carolina Herrera so I get your excitement,Ms. Horyn and the Times did a great job going backstage to capture the looks rather than images straight off the runway.

Sorry, I am not there yet with Halston. Didn't really understand it; though from twitter people seemed excited about it....

Marc Jacobs. So glad he got out of the 80's. Thank you for that. And the looks are so sublime. Really, from the ridiculous (last season) to the sublime. His female looked very sweet. And there are some to die for coats in there.

I'm feeling a little dressier for fall 2010 than this season which seems apropo, and not as tough. If anything more vulnerable in almost every collection....these shows lack swagger and pretention.

That's a good thing. Seems I'm not the only one whose had a tough year.....

Like I said, the final looks in red weren't quite of the execution of the first looks concerning Altuzarra, almost seemed like a bit of a separate thought ... definitely see the Carine Roitfeld connection ... but did you guys fall down and smack your little heads on the runway? Are we talking about the same Gucci Fall 2003 RTW? If you worked in the fashion industry, you would not say those collections are the same. I went back and looked at that collection to see if what was said had any validity, because what was being said didn't ring that strong of a bell, and not only was the palette different (which color should I begin with?), and some of the textures, but that Gucci collection was heavier, more dramatic. Sure, there were some faint similarities, particularly in a couple of the garments with harnesses, but this was a lighter, more focused, unburdened affair. Night and day. Tom Ford is not the first designer to put straps on gowns. Even if you didn't work in the fashion industry, you'd have to be half blind to say Altuzarra was like Gucci Fall 2003, and really stretch, over-generalize. I'm aghast. I thought Altuzarra was completely relevant for now. Everything in that Gucci collection had way more volume. If it had any more volume, those models would have achieved what 'balloon boy' in fact never did, fly away, which is what a certain argument against Altuzarra's collection is about to do. ;-) C'mon, Altuzarra was more subtle, sophisticated.

And by the way, Marc Jacobs was gorgeous, the grain on those beautiful hues of gray, subtle, powerful, my favorite parts. And I loved the minimalism of the opening look of what appeared to be a deconstructed sweat shirt or sweater, really effortless and set the whole tone, the overall clean lines and tailored look of all that great sportswear, so focused. I have to say, I think this is one of my favorite Marc Jacobs' collections ever, he showed a different side this time, and it felt very fresh, optimistic, beautiful, desirable, but practical, spot on. I still can't get over the use of fabric, the grain in those hues of gray, where did he get that fabric? He should make the source of that fabric a company trade secret.
rofimike: My guess is that they were decked out in fanciful wigs and orange face paint, which would qualify them for "loompah" status.

Skate well Johnny Weir.  You are the epitome of artistry on the ice.  Sometimes the anti-fur zealots engage in psychological terrorism; I'm glad JW played it safe and stayed in Olympic housing.  I hope JW gets the Olympic Medal he yearns for but I hope even more that he skates to the best of his ability.  That will be a joy to behold, medal or no medal.

For the second day in a row, I thought I was fast but turned out it was just an easy puzzle. Enjoyable nonetheless.

My son learned 20A before he was two: "James, what is it called when a caterpillar turns into a butterfly?" :)

Speaking of vegetarianism (which we were) and The Simpsons (which we weren't), one of my favorite episodes of all time is "Lisa the Vegetarian," including the late Phil Hartman as Troy McClure giving a tour of a meat processing plant. Plus the classic conga line: "You don't win friends with salad! You don't win friends with salad!" Cf. http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=0W5x5kugnbs and http://www.youtube.com...

@KS (#2): If EAT AT was eating at you, maybe you were thinking of ATE AT, which appeared twice in January. (My preferred clue: "Handful for a dairyman." Classic scene from "Witness" with Harrison Ford.)

Beautiful Entries: theme entries, bien sur, plus MAYTAG, HOT DOG, SCISSOR*, PRESIDIOS, SPARK PLUG*, CABOOSE

Clever Clues: "Low man in the choir," "Defib operator"

Misdirection: thinking fallen angels not mafiosi for "Underworld"

Errors: OCTO for OCTA (why isn't she called the OCTA-Mom?!), AW GEE for OH GEE, LOLL for STAY, H-BOMB for H-TEST

Shoulda Known Sooner: LOUTS (stuck on BOORS)

New Words: Refusenik

New Facts About Old Words: Audie Murphy film

Wikipedia Worthy: GRAN Canaria, Mekong and Yangtze Rivers, Joel and Ethan COEN*, Jacob and Wilhelm GRIMM, BOLOGNA, Sasha COHEN*, OCHO Rios, "Flo"

Crosswordese: EOS (82) / AURORA (18), the crossword puzzle's third favorite (at best) Greek / Roman god combo, after EROS (165) / AMOR (97) and ARES (147) / MARS (37) -- interesting that Greek trounces Roman!

Jim,

Thanks for the short short story link; Asimov did something very similar long long ago, but focused on reproduction; it's "What Is This Thing Called Love" and can be found in the Nightall anthology (see http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/What_is_This_Thing_Called_Love%3F_(short_story) )

Can't even manage a reliable Zamboni.
Shades of Sydney, which couldn't even set the vault at the proper height for the women's AA gymnastics final, and which then disqualified its gold medalist for taking cold medication. What a farce. Another faux Olympics.
"Postlude"?  Really?
it's zindabad not zinzabad

Having been against the Viet Nam war, to the point of doing whatever could be done to stop it, there was a day when there was a feeling that came over me that seemed to say that it is : "O:K" because it is over and it is going to end.

It ended.

It was not against the soldiers. It was not against the Government. It was against the fact that America and her friends had been drawn into a trap set up by evil people whom to this day profess that they aren't.

That same feeling came over me in the Holiday season. Talk about not wanting to believe something that you knew that you had to believe. It can't be put into words but it was that at that point that I realized/believed that Afghanistan was going to be won.

The Allies were going to prevail.

It ain't the 1870;s.

This ain't Viet Nam.

God Bless the troops.

What I meant is that civil society comes through schools and education work being done by the great commentators to this article, but it is impossible to get a reliable partner from civil society organisers (Aga Khan Foundation, others) because the logistics and violence associated with the great powers legacy. Bechtel's own legacy in the west was one of resource exploitation and environmental degradation but also technological marvel with the introduction of westinghouse machinery.

The connection between USA demands for Oil and this project is not clear in this article. The idea for the creation of the Taliban was to stabilize Afghanistan and the Central Asian region in order for Unocal to come in and drill in the 90s with a stable partner. But that, like the fantasies mentioned in this article shows all that is wrong with USAID with respect to development, it was always assumed that other countries would follow the same path as the United States with good Yankee ingeneuity and will and that fostering civil society is not as important as rapid economic profit for developing human capital.
love is a money spendered thing
love is a money spender thing
W.I.N.O.  wealthy in name only:  trust funders now unfunded

It is the elusive Unified Theory.

There is credible evidence of Love at first sight. Therefore the speed of love equals the speed of light. If we postulate L=F²c² we have proved that Love is powerful and dangerous.
Baaad aaad.

Nirvana (Sanskrit: nir + vana) = Free-of + Desire

or

Nibanna (Pali: nib + bana) = absence-of + Love

comments.commentBody: I like this story... every now and then I think it's a good idea to toss some ConVick red meat out there to give the rabble a chance to vent.  Who knows, it probably helps them keep happier homes getting all that pent up negative energy out of their systems.

comments.userLocation: In the castle of my skin
comments.commentBody: Spoke to Brandon three weeks ago at the G'town vs. Duke game and from what he says his recovery is going very well.  Without a doubt he regrets not having the surgery earlier in the season, but hindsight is always 20-20 as we know.
